src:
Anzulović novi trener članske ekipe Krke
07 Nov 2019, 09:05 by M. Ž.
Novo mesto - Članska ekipa košarkarskega kluba Krka ima novega trenerja. Na to mesto so imenovali 41-letnega Vladimirja Anzulović, ki je z ekipo že opravil prvi trening, so sporočili iz novomeškega kluba.
Anzulović, sicer po rodu Zagrebčan, že vrsto let živi v Novem mestu, kjer si je ustvaril tudi družino. Bil je član Krke, med drugim tudi v sezoni 2001/202, ko je ta igrala v evroligi, kasneje pa deloval tudi kot trener. V sezoni 2011/2012 je kot pomočnik trenerja Nenada Trajkovića in nato Aleksandra Sekulića s Krko osvojil naslov prvaka Lige Telemach.
Zatem je za dve leti odšel na Reko, kjer je kot glavni trener zelo uspešno vodil hrvaškega prvoligaša Kvarnerja in se z njim v obeh sezonah uvrstil v ligo za prvaka. V nadaljevanju je uspešno deloval v Šibeniku in Splitu, bil je tudi selektor hrvaške mladinske in univerzitetne reprezentance, so povzeli v Klubu.
Januarja leta 2016 na mestu prvega trenerja članske ekipe Krke nadomestil Ivana Velića, ki je nato po dobrem mesecu postala zmagovalka pokala Spar. V KK Krka je vodil tudi mladinski pogon.
text:
Anzulovic is the new coach of Krka's membership team
07 Nov 2019, 09:05 by M. Ž.
Novo mesto - The Krka Basketball Club membership team has a new coach. The 41-year-old Vladimir Anzulovic was appointed to the post, who has already completed his first training with the team, the club from Novo mesto said.
Anzulović, a Zagreb native, has lived in Novo mesto for many years, where he also started a family. He was a member of Krka, including during the 2001/202 season, when he played in the Euroleague and later worked as a coach. In the 2011/2012 season, as assistant coach to Nenad Trajkovic and then Aleksandar Sekulic with Krka, he won the league title of Telemach.
He then went to Rijeka for two years, where he successfully led the Croatian first-team player Kvarner as a head coach, and with him became a champion league in both seasons. He continued to work successfully in Sibenik and Split, and was also the coach of the Croatian junior and university national team, the Club concluded.
In January 2016, he replaced Ivan Velic as the first coach of Krka's membership team, who then won the Spar Cup after a month. He also ran a youth drive at KK Krka.
